Titre: Google fixes two Android zero-day bugs actively exploited by hackers
Summary_article: On Monday,

that fixes two zero-day flaws that “may be under limited, targeted exploitation,” as the company put it. That means Google is aware that hackers have been and may still be using the bugs to compromise Android devices in real world scenarios.

Titre: Take the stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Apply to speak now
Summary_article: If you’re reading this, consider it your signal: the opportunity to influence the future of tech is here.

Titre: Amazon’s Zoox begins robotaxi testing in Los Angeles
Summary_article: Zoox, Amazon’s autonomous vehicle unit, is deploying a small fleet of retrofitted test vehicles on the streets of Los Angeles starting Tuesday – a modest, yet meaningful step as the company inches toward offering public rides in Las Vegas and San Francisco later this year.

Titre: Los Angeles-based Rain raised a $75M Series B in another good sign for fintech
Summary_article: Rain, a startup offering an employer-integrated earned wage access (EWA) app coupled with financial-wellness features like overdraft alerts and spending trends, has raised $75 million in an all-equity Series B round.

Titre: Founders, TechCrunch Startup Battlefield 200 is calling! Apply to enter!
Summary_article: Founders, the battlefield is calling!

Titre: Trump to endorse coal for data center power in the face of grim market realities
Summary_article: President Donald Trump is set to sign an executive order on Tuesday aimed at boosting coal’s flagging fortunes,
Bloomberg.

Titre: Volunteer your time for a free ticket to TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Summary_article: Join us for an unforgettable opportunity at

, happening at UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall on June 5! We’re on the lookout for enthusiastic volunteers to be part of this exciting event. If you’ve ever wondered what goes into the making of tech gatherings, now’s your chance to find out firsthand.

Titre: Waymo may use interior camera data to train generative AI models, but riders will be able to opt out
Summary_article: Waymo is preparing to use data from its robotaxis, including video from interior cameras tied to rider identities, to train generative AI models, according to an unreleased version of its
found by researcher Jane Manchun Wong, raising fresh questions about how much of a rider’s behavior inside autonomous vehicles could be repurposed for AI training.

Titre: Meet the new Audience Choice winners to lead breakouts at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
Summary_article: You voted. They rose to the top!

Titre: Mira Murati’s AI startup gains prominent ex-OpenAI advisers
Summary_article: Ex-OpenAI CTO Mira Murati’s new AI venture,

, has gained two new prominent advisers: Bob McGrew, previously OpenAI’s chief research officer, and Alec Radford, a former OpenAI researcher behind many of the company’s more transformative innovations.

Titre: Snapchat rolls out Sponsored AI Lenses for brands
Summary_article: Snapchat is introducing Sponsored AI Lenses, a new ad format that lets brands engage with consumers in an immersive way. While Snapchat has offered brands the opportunity to pay for sponsored lenses on the platform for years, now they can leverage AI-generated experiences powered by Snap’s proprietary generative AI technology.

Titre: Amazon unveils a new AI voice model, Nova Sonic
Summary_article: On Tuesday, Amazon debuted a new generative AI model, Nova Sonic, capable of natively processing voice and generating natural-sounding speech. Amazon claims that Sonic’s performance is competitive with frontier voice models from OpenAI and Google on benchmarks measuring speed, speech recognition, and conversational quality.

Titre: Blackbird gobbles up $50M for its blockchain-based payment-loyalty app for restaurants
Summary_article: A founder who has carved out a name for himself building products to help restaurants connect better with would-be diners has raised $50 million for his latest startup: a new take on the idea of customer loyalty.

Titre: XL Batteries is using petrochemical infrastructure to store solar and wind power
Summary_article: Plenty of materials — from sulfur and sodium to manganese and organic molecules — have tried to topple the
. And, so far, they’ve all failed.

Titre: Sizl raises $3.5M to expand its cook-to-order food delivery service
Summary_article: Dark kitchens– also referred to as ghost kitchens, cloud kitchens, or virtual kitchens– often receive criticism for their food quality.
, a cook-to-order delivery service based in Chicago, seeks to change this perception by delivering meals made with fresh ingredients in around 30 minutes flat.

Titre: Meta introduces restricted Teen Accounts to Facebook and Messenger
Summary_article: Meta is introducing Teen Accounts to Facebook and Messenger. The feature, which automatically enrolls young users into an app experience with built-in protections, will be available on these platforms in the U.S., U.K., Australia, and Canada before expanding to additional regions in the future.

Titre: Turkey’s Sipay raises $78M to expand its Stripe-like services into emerging markets
Summary_article: Billing itself as “Stripe for emerging markets,” Turkish Fintech
has raised a $78 million Series B funding round, claiming a valuation of $875 million in the process.

Titre: Apple might import more iPhones from India to side-step China tariffs
Summary_article: Apple is considering importing more iPhones from India to side-step the 54% additional tariffs on goods imported from China that U.S. President Donald Trump announced last week,
reported, citing anonymous sources.

Titre: IBM releases a new mainframe built for the age of AI
Summary_article: IBM is releasing the latest version of its mainframe hardware that includes new updates meant to accelerate AI adoption.

Titre: Google is allegedly paying some AI staff to do nothing for a year rather than join rivals
Summary_article: Retaining top AI talent is tough amid cutthroat competition between Google, OpenAI, and other heavyweights.

Titre: Microsoft reportedly fires staff whose protest interrupted its Copilot event
Summary_article: On Monday, Microsoft
terminated the roles of two software engineers, Ibtihal Aboussad and Vaniya Agrawal, who
during Microsoft’s Copilot and 50th anniversary event last week.

Titre: Analyst says Apple, Tesla have biggest exposure to Trump’s tariffs
Summary_article: Wedbush Securities analyst Dan Ives slashed his price targets for
over the weekend as President Trump’s tariffs threaten to disrupt both businesses.

Titre: Former Tesla exec Drew Baglino’s new startup is rethinking the electrical transformer
Summary_article: Former Tesla executive Drew Baglino has a new startup developing solid-state transformers for the electric grid, Axios

Titre: Shopify CEO tells teams to consider using AI before growing headcount
Summary_article: In a recent memo to employees, Shopify CEO Tobi Lütke made a bold policy change: teams must demonstrate why AI can’t perform a job before they’re permitted to ask for more headcount and resources.

Titre: Want to stay young? Peter Diamandis says survive the next 10 years
Summary_article: Peter Diamandis, a futurist with degrees from both MIT and Harvard, has spent much of the past two decades evangelizing a vision of an abundant future driven by exponential technologies that will lengthen our lives. The serial entrepreneur and founder of organizations like the XPRIZE Foundation and Singularity University has also cultivated close ties with some of the world’s most influential business minds, including Elon Musk.
